title: CatBoostClassifier is missing one of the binary classes in the shap matrix
body:
Tested with `shap==0.39.0` and `catboost==0.26`.

Using the `TreeExplainer` the `RandomForestClassifier` outputs shape `(2, 3, 4)`, i.e. 2 classes, 3 samples, 4 features, whereas `CatBoostClassifier` only outputs shape `(3, 4)`. 

Is this intentional?


```python
from catboost import CatBoostClassifier
from shap import TreeExplainer
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

RF = True

train_data = np.array([[1, 4, 5, 6],
                       [4, 5, 6, 7],
                       [30, 40, 50, 60]])

train_labels = np.array([0, 1, 1])

model = RandomForestClassifier() if RF else CatBoostClassifier(iterations=1, depth=1)

model.fit(train_data, train_labels)
preds_proba = model.predict_proba(train_data)
print(preds_proba)

explainer = TreeExplainer(model=model)
shap = explainer.shap_values(X=train_data, check_additivity=False)

print(np.array(shap).shape)
```
